title: MySQLSQRT()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLSQRT()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the square root of a number:
SELECT SQRT(64);

Definition and Usage
The SQRT() function returns the square root of a number.
Syntax
SQRT(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A number to calculate the square root of. Must be greater than 0
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the square root of a number:
SELECT SQRT(13);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLSQRT()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLSQRT()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLSQRT()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
